Package toy.servers

Class ToyServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • toy.config.Node
      • toy.servers.ToyServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Server
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CTServer
    public abstract class ToyServer
extends Node
implements Server
    An implementation of the base class of a Toy server. Every specific Toy implementation should derive from this class and implement the leader phase (for example, implement an asynchronous server)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ToyServer

        public ToyServer​(java.lang.String addr,
                 int wrbPort,
                 int id,
                 int channel,
                 int f,
                 int maxTx,
                 boolean fastMode,
                 WrbNode wrb,
                 RBrodcastService panic,
                 RBrodcastService sync)
        Toy server constructor
        Parameters:
        addr - the ip of the server
        wrbPort - the port on which it receives new blocks
        id - server ID
        channel - the number of channels (with single Toy group it is always 1)
        f - an upper bound on the number of faulty nodes
        maxTx - max transactions per block
        fastMode - indicates to run a single communication step protocol (rhater than two) by piggybacking the next block to the first BBC message
        wrb - an instance of wrb service
        panic - an instance of panic service
        sync - an instance of sync service

      • ToyServer

        public ToyServer​(java.lang.String addr,
                 int wrbPort,
                 int id,
                 int channel,
                 int f,
                 int tmo,
                 int tmoInterval,
                 int maxTx,
                 boolean fastMode,
                 java.util.ArrayList<Node> cluster,
                 java.lang.String bbcConfig,
                 java.lang.String panicConfig,
                 java.lang.String syncConfig,
                 java.lang.String serverCrt,
                 java.lang.String serverPrivKey,
                 java.lang.String caRoot)
        Toy server constructor
        Parameters:
        addr - the ip of the server
        wrbPort - the port on which it receives new blocks
        id - server ID
        channel - the number of channels (with a single Toy group it is always 1)
        f - an upper bound on the number of faulty nodes
        tmo - the initial time-out to wait in wrb-deliver
        tmoInterval - the interval to add to tmo in case wrb was failed to deliver the message in a single round
        maxTx - max transactions per block
        fastMode - indicates to run a single communication step protocol (rhater than two) by piggybacking * the next block to the first BBC message
        cluster - a list of Nodes that compose the network
        bbcConfig - a path to the configuration directory of wrb
        panicConfig - a path to the configuration directory of panic
        syncConfig - a path to the configuration directory of sync
        serverCrt - a path to the server certificate
        serverPrivKey - a path to the server ssl private key
        caRoot - a path to the ca certificate. If equals to "" the server will trust any certificate

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Description copied from interface: Server
        Initiates the underlying protocols of a Toy based server (i.e bft-SMaRt).
        Specified by:
        start in interface Server

      • start

        public void start​(boolean group)
        Starts the server as either part of Toys (e.g as with Top) or a single server
        Parameters:
        group - indicates if this server is part of group of Toys that collaborate wrb, panic and sync services

      • serve

        public void serve()
        Description copied from interface: Server
        Start the server. After calling this method the server should be able to serve clients requests. The reason for why start ane serve are separated is dut to the fact that TOY great power is when the system is fault-less and synchronized. By this separation we can wait for the system to get synchronized before starting to server clients requests.
        Specified by:
        serve in interface Server

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Description copied from interface: Server
        Shutting down the server. After invoking this method the server is unable to server more requests as well as to participate the algorithm.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface Server

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown​(boolean group)
        shutdown the server as either part of Toys (e.g as with Top) or a single server
        Parameters:
        group - indicates if this server is part of group of Toys that collaborate wrb, panic and sync services

      • gc

        public void gc​(int index)
        Clear the data of block i from all layers of the algorithm, leaving only its header in the Blockchain. This method is essential to ease the memory bounds of Toy.
        Parameters:
        index - the block to evacuate

      • initBC

        public abstract Blockchain initBC​(int id,
                                  int channel)
        Initiate the Blockchain of this server
        Parameters:
        id - the server ID
        channel - the channel ID (with a single Toy group this is always 0)
        Returns:
        new empty Blockchain

                                 int end)

        Parameters:
        start - the index to start with the sub-blockchain
        end - the index to end with the sub-blockchain
        Returns:
        a sub-blockchain fron start to end

                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException

      • nonBlockingDeliver

        public Types.Block nonBlockingDeliver​(int index)
        Description copied from interface: Server

        Specified by:
        nonBlockingDeliver in interface Server
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the block to be delivered
        Returns:
        The desired block if exists or null if it does not
